body: Hi All, I've always had good luck here, so I'll try another one. I´m trying to run a daylight simulation and optimization considering some shading surfaces designed in Rhino and i´m using the "HoneyBee EP context Surfaces" component. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jCEO2AQNowcgZn*mEVSFR2vfx87sDpCcS1PZEsjERkrrKM-KyTGZBAjVtNal1GBjxo76*jmNY*ehNbV98u*HUpAVHHVmdnD4/1.JPG) As you can see the problem is that my "shading surfaces" in input are trimmed and untrimmed surfaces, because for my optimization i want them to rotate and to change their depths, but that makes the error in the "HoneyBee EP context Surfaces" component (error: **"NoneType" object has no attribute "faces"**), while if i had referenced brep in input i wouldn´t have any problem. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jCEO2AQNowej2LThTyW*y1O2rAzcLmia*RHkHKXfCPly25gHmLIsHh6kSlb75bYEl535sgUCxrFGJd7uq*yrut4F8oH2DM8k/2.JPG) What should i do if i want to maintain all the geometry changes? Thanks in advanced Claudia
topic: HoneyBee EP context Surfaces_(Un)Trimmed surfaces problem
